blog.name: jamkam123
blog.title: Sansasuport
blog.description: All things Jonsa and a few other fandoms

summary:
Let start with my favorite: Sansa
Ok first off she is not weak! She wanted to stay up on the battlements with Arya but knew that...
body:
Women of GoT S8 Ep3

Let start with my favorite: Sansa

Ok first off she is not weak! She wanted to stay up on the battlements with Arya but knew that she would just be a liability up there so she left. I think she was talking to herself just as much as she was talking to Tyrion when she said they needed to look the truth in the face, and the truth is they are not great soldiers they are great thinkers. However she shows her courage when she is willing to fight in the crypts (I have never been so mad at anything as much as I am about the fact that they cut the scene where she killed whites!!!) This moment above was one of my favorites of the episode because is shows their fear, their respect for eachother, and that they are gaining streangth from eachother. They are both hiding because of fear and individually they might have stayed hidden but they realize together that they are strong and brave and that they need to do something and they do. Also I never shipped them before but seriously Sophie Turner has chemistry with everything she comes in contact with 😍🥰

Daenerys

I want to preface this section by saying that she is not my favorite character. Whis that said I think that the reason people think she was useless is because they expected to much from her. The people who expected her to single handedly defeat the NK were not being practical because besides having dragons she is not really that useful in battle, and we knew from last episode that dragon fire would probably not work because Bran was all like 🤷‍♂️. For those who complained that her picking up a sword and fighting was unrealistic and stupid, I would say it would have been if she picked up a weapon for the first time and was Arya level skilled but she was not. It is not impossible that the fear of death and adrenaline would give her the streangth and fortitude to pick up a sword and use it. Even in real life people d amazing things when their life or the lives of their loved ones are in danger (so for me this is compleatly practical). However that fact that between her and Jorah, they beat back an entire swarm of the dead, that gets a little more unbelievable.

Missandei

She stood up for her queen, her friend, the person she believes the most in; this is not a surprise or anything to get rieled up about. It did surprise me that neither she or greyworm died and so I am expecting something from their story line (something other than seeing the breaches again).

Brienne

How did she not die. Don’t get me wrong I love her and I want her to be Sansa’s Queens Guard, but her ark has ended. I thought the only way she would survive is if someone sacrificed themselves for her (like Tormund, Jamie, or Pod). There were sooooo many characters that I don’t understand how they survived and she is just in the long list. If you are in the front lines and never get a break, I don’t care how good you are at fighting one of them are going to die. Ok rant over, I am glad she survived I just don’t understand.

Lyanna Mormont

Ok, so this was bad ass but it felt a little too fan service-y. I have had all kinds of feeling for her over the years but it was sad to see her go. I will miss the way she put Jon in his place when he was being stupid (especially because people seem fine when Lyanna does it but they throw a freakin fit when Sansa tell him he is being an asshole).

Melisandre

I have never been a fan of her but she fuckin did the damn thing. She came out and showed us all that Dany is not the only one with a little fire power. I was a little disappointed that there was no conversation about being on Arya’s list but they did have a nice moment. Also I really like that she went out on her own accord and that Davos let her walk into the abyss (because he clearly wanted to go after her and execute her).

Arya

So if you are still reading then I have not totally piss you off yet but I am about to so here we go. I don’t understand why Arya was the one to kill the NK? I screamed with joy when she did (and I am happy that it was not Jon or Dany) but it just does not make sense. I understand wanting to shock people and have someone unexpected kill him but why not Bran or Sam, who have both been studying and obsessing over him for years. Arya has been studying killing and has been a student of the god of death but it does not add to her story line or character arch. it was a cool sense (amazing visuals) but it just does not add anything to the story.

reblog.comment:
Women of GoT S8 Ep3

Let start with my favorite: Sansa

Ok first off she is not weak! She wanted to stay up on the battlements with Arya but knew that she would just be a liability up there so she left. I think she was talking to herself just as much as she was talking to Tyrion when she said they needed to look the truth in the face, and the truth is they are not great soldiers they are great thinkers. However she shows her courage when she is willing to fight in the crypts (I have never been so mad at anything as much as I am about the fact that they cut the scene where she killed whites!!!) This moment above was one of my favorites of the episode because is shows their fear, their respect for eachother, and that they are gaining streangth from eachother. They are both hiding because of fear and individually they might have stayed hidden but they realize together that they are strong and brave and that they need to do something and they do. Also I never shipped them before but seriously Sophie Turner has chemistry with everything she comes in contact with 😍🥰

Daenerys

I want to preface this section by saying that she is not my favorite character. Whis that said I think that the reason people think she was useless is because they expected to much from her. The people who expected her to single handedly defeat the NK were not being practical because besides having dragons she is not really that useful in battle, and we knew from last episode that dragon fire would probably not work because Bran was all like 🤷‍♂️. For those who complained that her picking up a sword and fighting was unrealistic and stupid, I would say it would have been if she picked up a weapon for the first time and was Arya level skilled but she was not. It is not impossible that the fear of death and adrenaline would give her the streangth and fortitude to pick up a sword and use it. Even in real life people d amazing things when their life or the lives of their loved ones are in danger (so for me this is compleatly practical). However that fact that between her and Jorah, they beat back an entire swarm of the dead, that gets a little more unbelievable.

Missandei

She stood up for her queen, her friend, the person she believes the most in; this is not a surprise or anything to get rieled up about. It did surprise me that neither she or greyworm died and so I am expecting something from their story line (something other than seeing the breaches again).

Brienne

How did she not die. Don’t get me wrong I love her and I want her to be Sansa’s Queens Guard, but her ark has ended. I thought the only way she would survive is if someone sacrificed themselves for her (like Tormund, Jamie, or Pod). There were sooooo many characters that I don’t understand how they survived and she is just in the long list. If you are in the front lines and never get a break, I don’t care how good you are at fighting one of them are going to die. Ok rant over, I am glad she survived I just don’t understand.

Lyanna Mormont

Ok, so this was bad ass but it felt a little too fan service-y. I have had all kinds of feeling for her over the years but it was sad to see her go. I will miss the way she put Jon in his place when he was being stupid (especially because people seem fine when Lyanna does it but they throw a freakin fit when Sansa tell him he is being an asshole).

Melisandre

I have never been a fan of her but she fuckin did the damn thing. She came out and showed us all that Dany is not the only one with a little fire power. I was a little disappointed that there was no conversation about being on Arya’s list but they did have a nice moment. Also I really like that she went out on her own accord and that Davos let her walk into the abyss (because he clearly wanted to go after her and execute her).

Arya

So if you are still reading then I have not totally piss you off yet but I am about to so here we go. I don’t understand why Arya was the one to kill the NK? I screamed with joy when she did (and I am happy that it was not Jon or Dany) but it just does not make sense. I understand wanting to shock people and have someone unexpected kill him but why not Bran or Sam, who have both been studying and obsessing over him for years. Arya has been studying killing and has been a student of the god of death but it does not add to her story line or character arch. it was a cool sense (amazing visuals) but it just does not add anything to the story.

body: arya gave sansa a dagger before forcing her down to the crypts and told her “stick them with the pointy end.” the last time we watched a stark give another stark a weapon was when bran gave arya the valyrian dagger. the one that ended the night king. maybe this means sansa will use the dagger arya gave to her in 8x03 in the future?

blog.name: argellastarkiller
blog.description: han and leia // natasha romanoff // i'm bitter. don't tell me not to be because i will bite you.

tags: i will not take any slander towards both of them
summary: Daenerys Targaryen and Sansa Stark did not go through so much shit navigating and rising in a male-dominated world only for fans...
body:
Daenerys Targaryen and Sansa Stark did not go through so much shit navigating and rising in a male-dominated world only for fans to pit them against each other using a sexist and masculine standard. Some of you have never encountered enough female representation and it shows.

Also, it’s important to note that despite the scene of her and Tyrion actually fighting wights being deleted, it was already implied that they did fight, because they went out from behind the wall.

summary: I think the problem with D&D is they really don't understand how it feels to be a teenage girl forced into marriage with an...
question: I think the problem with D&D is they really don't understand how it feels to be a teenage girl forced into marriage with an older man who is a drunken womanizer and your family's enemy. I get they're guys and that isn't their experience, but surely, they could have done some actual research into child brides? GRMM isn't a perfect writer, but he at least made sure to show how bad the relationship between Sansa and Tyrion was, and how she had no power and gained no love or respect from him.
answer:
San*rions are now using “otp: the best of them” as a tag I’m jhdfsgjadfsgfas an actual frog would be better as a husband??? “otp: better than the night king”

D&D don’t understand sexual violence. Gendry’s anger and sadness about what happened to him obviously came from Joe Dempsie. Sansa’s cold exterior in s7, the anger she was feeling in s6, the horror and pain she was enduring in s5 came from Sophie Turner. To D&D just because Tyrion didn’t rape Sansa, their marriage was pleasant. They never bothered exploring how it felt to be forced into a marriage with a man belong to a family Sansa hated, how it felt to be moments away from escaping KL by marrying Loras only for that to be taken away and now she’s married and still in KL, the terror of knowing that eventually they would have to consummate the marriage, etc. The thing that caused them to finally portray the relationship closer to how it happens in the books is the Red Wedding. Before then Sansa and Tyrion were friends. Sansa never comments on the injustice after she escapes and she remembers how kind Tyrion was because he never assaulted her. Some of Sansa’s friendliness towards Tyrion was Sansa adapting to her situation (like Margaery advised her to) but some of it was because D&D could not imagine someone disliking a charismatic individual like Tyrion and that’s a problem.

Sansa’s cold exterior in s7, the anger she was feeling in s6, the horror and pain she was enduring in s5 came from Sophie Turner. To D&D just because Tyrion didn’t rape Sansa, their marriage was pleasant. They never bothered exploring how it felt to be forced into a marriage with a man belong to a family Sansa hated, how it felt to be moments away from escaping KL by marrying Loras only for that to be taken away and now she’s married and still in KL, the terror of knowing that eventually they would have to consummate the marriage, etc. The thing that caused them to finally portray the relationship closer to how it happens in the books is the Red Wedding. Before then Sansa and Tyrion were friends. Sansa never comments on the injustice after she escapes and she remembers how kind Tyrion was because he never assaulted her. Some of Sansa’s friendliness towards Tyrion was Sansa adapting to her situation (like Margaery advised her to) but some of it was because D&D could not imagine someone disliking a charismatic individual like Tyrion and that’s a problem.

body:
Rewatched 1.01…

Hey Jonsa fam! Just some thoughts about the Jon-Sansa-Tyrion love triangle that I think we will see it someway or another.

In the first episode of GoT, we see Tyrion and Ros having sex. Tyrion and Jon have also their first conversation in this episode. We learn a few episodes later that Jon wanted Ros but he just couldn’t do it because he feared fathering a bastard. So there is a kind of connection between Jon-Ros-Tyrion .

With the shot from 8.03 where they got us confused between Tyrion and Jon just after the heartbreaking Sansa/Tyrion scene in the crypts, and with the conversations between Tyrion and Sansa from the beginning of this season, I really do believe we could see an explicit Jon-Sansa-Tyrion love triangle…(And I would love to see this!!)

If you think about it, Tyrion had Ros and Jon didn’t, although he wanted too…

What if the roles are reversed in the end?

Tyrion had a chance to share Sansa’s bed but she never agreed to…Tyrion talked twice about their marriage, first time to Jon and then to Sansa…

Since the beginning of the season, I do believe that Tyrion still has Sansa in his mind and she seems to have a special place in his heart. He really has a soft spot for her and I do think he wants her to love him.

I do believe in Jonsa since their reunion hug in 6.04 and the Tyrion/Jon transition shot in 8.03 got me thinking a lot.

What if in the end Jon is the one who “gets” his readhead and Tyrion doesn’t?

summary: Why do you think Sansa would kill Tyrion? Do you mean by the TV show, or the books?
question: Why do you think Sansa would kill Tyrion? Do you mean by the TV show, or the books?
answer:
I’m curious, what makes you think Sansa is going to kill Tyrion? She’s my fav and I wouldn’t want to see her get hated on cuz she killed one of the general audience’s fav

Sophie, Maisie, Isaac, Jacob, the dude playing Harry Strickland, Peter were in Seville where they shot dragonpit scenes. Anyway they were filming a trial for Tyrion because he did something bad with Sansa as the judge. It’s his third trial and you know the rule about threes. Peter (and Emilia) wasn’t promoting much despite being a fan favourite which tells you a lot about his storyline. Peter was also spotted with Kit, and someone Friki claimed was Iain but now it’s obvious he was guessing, in the King’s landing set which was destroyed by huge fires. There was a large CGI mount for a dragon while they were filming the fires. A huge tunnel was constructed so obviously for people to escape through. 

That’s why I think Sansa will kill Tyrion. Tyrion is a villain in the books, the show has been a little late in catching up

title: ok, let me explain....
body:
I never had a ship from GoT, and I have watched the series from episode 1 of season 1, read half the books and was always watching for the plot….
But recently, some videos on youtube started showing up in my related (probably because I’m crazy for Sophie Turner in the upcoming Dark Phoenix movie as I’m a huge fan) and I saw a couple of videos of Sansa and Jon and I was like hmmm

and naturally, I went to Ao3 and read a couple of stories, good one shots and some multichap and I was like…

AND THEN I saw something about prompts on tumblr, and I knew where my next place should be, so I came back to my mama site and checked the jonsa tag and I was like….

and I found out about the subplots and the pol!jon and the hints about Dany (which I never liked to be honest, I want either Cersei or Sansa to take the throne and be done with it lol) but I put the pieces together and….

WE’RE CANON AND I LOVE JONSA AND I HATE IT THAT I HAVEN’T BEEN ON THE SHIP BEFORE, WHAT THE FUCK WHERE HAVE I BEEN? truth is season 7 was so tiring and season 6 was ages ago so I guess I missed the jonsa (although I loved their scenes I never read in to them) so yes, I just stumbled on the ship’s deck but my sword is drawn and I’m ready to fight, shipmates!

*for the King Crow and the Little Dove!!!* For JONSAAAAAAA
